Nerangs.ab: avval se serešk u zamin duḫtan aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha miguyad šir u ǧāmdān midušad digar aṣ̌a.sara vacaŋha miguyad šir u ǧāmdān midušad digar aṣ̌a.sara š́iiaoθəna miguyad ǧām andar ǧāmdān midušad

"First, he should milk three drops onto the earth while he says aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha. He says further aṣ̌a.sara vacaŋha and milks milk into the ǧāmdān. He further says aṣ̌a.sara š́iiaoθəna and milks the ǰīwām into the ǰīwāmdān."

va pas aṣ̌a andak-i dušad sara andak-i dušad manaŋha andak-i dušad aṣ̌a andak-i dušad sara andak-i dušad vacaŋha andak-i dušad aṣ̌a andak-i dušad sara.š́iiaōθna inǧā har čand ke ḫᵛāhad be-dušad va be-hamān peštān ke avval dušide ke wāǧ gerefte andak-i dušad aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha ke guyad hamā gav yā gusfand be negarad va be har vāǧe yek duš be-dušad tā sar-e u āḫer pas har čandān ke ḫᵛāhad be-dušad va pas be-ān pestān ke vāǧ gerefte be āḫer az ān pestān ǧodā nakonad va guyad š́iiaōθna va dast bar hamān pestān ǧodā nakonad

"Then, he milks a drop at aṣ̌a; he milks a drop at sara. He milks a drop at manaŋha. He milks a drop at aṣ̌a. He milks a drop at aṣ̌a. He milks a drop at vacaŋha. He milks a drop at aṣ̌a (and continues with) sara.š́iiaōθna. Now, he milks a furtehr drop so many times as he wants from the same udder from which he milked when they took the wāz. When he milks while he says aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha, he looks at the cow or sheep and at each word he milks once until it has no more milk. Then he milks as much as he wants (from other udder), but at the end he does not separate his hand from the udder at which he took the vāǧ and he says š́iiaōθna without removing the hand from this very same udder."

Quotations.ab: u-š aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha be gōwišn u-š hamē gōspand be āyēd aṣ̌a.sara vacaŋha aṣ̌a.sara š́iiaōθana ka abestāg wēš gōwēd jīw kam gīrēd ā nē šāyēd ka kam gōwēd ud wēš gīrēd ā nē šāyēd ka-š tanuk-ā-tanuk pad dōšišn andar ōftēd ā šāyēd ka 'mōy tāg pad kanišn andar ōftēd ā šāyēd ka-š rēš-ē pad *ōy pestān ka abāg dast be āyēd ā šāyēd

"He has to say aṣ̌a.sara manaŋha and he goes to the animal. (Then he continues with) aṣ̌a.sara vacaŋha aṣ̌a.sara š́iiaōθana. When he says more abestāg or takes less ǰīwām, this is not allowed. When while milking, (the milk) falls in very thin squirts, this is allowed. If a hair falls on him while pressing (the udders), it is allowed. If there is hair in the breasts, it is allowed, when it can be removed with the hand."
